means: 使清楚，澄清( clarify的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_cn: 他的头脑突然清醒起来.

sentence.Network_en: Certain questions have yet to be clarified.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些问题还需要弄清楚.

sentence.Network_en: The only way his role can be clarified and his position made tenable again is if there's a public inquiry.
sentence.Network_cn: 弄清他扮演的角色并再次证明他的合理立场的唯一办法是展开公开调查。

Sentence.sentence: The 1976 copy right act has not prevented these abuses fully, but it has clarified the legal rights of the injured parties and given them an avenue for remedy.
Its meaning was clarified when it was established in Australia.
